intro: Dyschoriste hispidula, commonly known as the hairy dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Dyschoriste hispidula is often found in lowland areas and is adapted to thrive in humid climates.
